titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. Whereas we have received certain information, that James Duke of Monmouth, Ford late Lord Gray outlawed for high treason, with divers other traitors and outlaws, are lately landed in an hostile manner at Lyme ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by the assigns of John Bill deceast: and by Henry Hills, and Thomas Newcomb, printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty,
re-printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to his most sacred Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Dated at end: Given at Our Court at Whitehall this thirteenth day of June, 1685. And in the first year of Our Reign.
Royal coat of arms at head of text; initial letter.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
